title: Is Firefox safe enough for handling sensitive patient data when booking appointments online?
content:
As someone working in healthcare, I can confirm that privacy is a top priority — especially when it comes to online appointment systems or communicating with patients through forms and messaging tools.

We use Firefox at our clinic because of its strong privacy controls and anti-tracking features. Some tips I can recommend:

Turn on Enhanced Tracking Protection (always).

Use private browsing for managing sensitive logins.

Regularly clear cache & cookies if using a shared or clinic device.

Install add-ons like uBlock Origin and HTTPS Everywhere for extra security.

That said, while the browser plays a big role, your website's infrastructure (like SSL certificates, encrypted forms, etc.) matters just as much. Make sure your site provider is HIPAA/GDPR-compliant if you're handling patient info online.

Hope this helps! If you are curious about our Dentalist service visit our website in the bio.
creator: dentalist03

title: What happened to my bookmarks?
content:
My bookmarks previously would be displayed on the left of the screen when I start Firefox. For some reason someone thought it would be an improvement to force me to use another click to show my bookmarks. Forcing the user to make more clicks is NEVER a good design choice. There seems to be no setting for getting my bookmarks displayed by default. Now there is just a setting whether or not to show a "sidebar" with a button I must click to show the bookmarks. Bring back my bookmarks please, or add a setting to allow me to get them back.

Thanks.
creator: R_Stover

title: When connecting TB4 with U3225QE, only Firefox changes color
content: DELL's new monitor, U3225QE, can be connected via Thunderbolt 4. I can display 120Hz and Edge and Chrome display without any problems. Only in Firefox there are some areas that should be displayed in white but are displayed in pink. By the way, when connected via HDMI 2.1, the display is 120Hz without any discoloration. If you turn on the dynamic refresh rate, the screen will go black every time you move the mouse. When it is OFF, Firefox browsing does not change color and can be used normally, I called Dell support and they told me, "That's probably a problem with Firefox." By the way, the hardware configuration is CPU:AMD Ryzen7 9700X Mother Board:Asrock B650M HDV-M.2 Video Card:Asrock Radeon7600XT Challenger 16GB OC Thunderbolt 4 Expansion Card: GIGABYTE GC-MAPLE RIDGE It would be helpful if Mozilla could address this issue.
creator: george58sika
